intro: Solanum cearense, commonly known as the Ceará nightshade, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and potatoes. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are ovate and hairy, while its flowers are usually white or pale purple. The fruit is a small, yellowish berry that contains several seeds.
